_header: I have sought thee many a day
Subjects: death; Christ, grace of; dialogues; devil, speech of a
_description: On the mercy of Christ in saving the dying man from the devil — three couplets

BLAdd37049.Transcription:
I haue sought the many a dayFor to haue the to my prayCommitt
                    thy body to the grauePray Christ thy soule to saueTho it be late ere
                    thou mercie craueYet mercie thou shall haue
BLAdd37049.Note:
Names of speakers, devil, Friar and Christ precede each couplet, and
                    another heading, for corpse to speak, follows but without text.
BLAdd37049.Editions:
Heffernan,  Thomas J. 
             “The Virgin as an Aid to Salvation in Some Fifteenth-Century English and
                Latin Verses.” 
             Medium Ævum
         52 (1983): 229-38: 235-6.
